author: discombobulater
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

Currently you cannot do the following due to the cmdlets parameter sets:
restart-computer -ComputerName Server.contoso.com -wait -for PowerShell -Force -AsJob

BUT you can wrap it in a start-job scriptblock and it works as expected:
start-job -scriptblock { restart-computer -ComputerName satisbrt001 -wait -for PowerShell -Force }

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Note that you can now simply append `&` to any command / pipeline in order to run it as a job - it is like an implicit `Start-Job` call, and as such it doesn't rely on individual commands' `-AsJob` parameters.

```powershell
$job = restart-computer -ComputerName Server.contoso.com -wait -for PowerShell -Force &
 ```
